captions.text: ("Justice Creed")
- [Man with Glasses] Rum raisin.
- [Woman with Short Hair] Mmmm, golly
they give a (bleep) about their Kit Kats.

- The packaging's so lovely,
but it's so deceiving.
I don't know what I'm about to eat.
- Definitely smells very strongly of rum.
- Oh, hell yes.
- Oh.
- [Man in Glasses] This taste a lot like
Captain Morgan in a Kit Kat.
- [Man with Beard] It tastes like there's
a shot of rum in this Kit Kat.
And I'm just gonna be sober.

I can drive home after I
eat a whole box of this.

- [Woman in Scarf] A
(speaking in Japanese) blend.
Which means citrus golden blend flavor.
- Have a break, have a Kit Kat.
It's funny, it's like not quite
give me a break, give me a Kit Kat.

- That smells like that's
citrus right there.
- Hmmmm.
- This is delicious.
- It kinda tastes like a creamsicle.
- First you get some orange,
then it gets very lemony.
- This isn't your ever day Kit Kat.
This is like a...

- And then you're like,"Is
that lime that I taste?"

- When you wanna spice things
up a little bit Kit Kat.

This is like you're
introducing role playing
into the bedroom kinda Kit Kat.

- [Man with Glasses] The
hot Japanese chili flavor.

- [Woman with Scarf] Hot
Japanese chili flavor.
Maybe it's just for sexy Japanese people.
- This box looks very dangerous.
- This is just straight up dark chocolate.
What does the pepper mean...
Oh, wait, (laughs) oh yeah it's spice, oh.
- Oh, oh.
- Yeah, you found it.
This is the best Kit Kat ever.
- It's getting a little spicy now.
Give it like a minute.
It's like a minute chocolate.
- It's like a hint of spice,
but it's a perfect hint of spice.
- No, you think it's dark chocolate,
and then habam!
- I wanna hug the guy who invented this.

- [Man with Glasses] Pile
of purple rope flavored.

- [Woman with Short
Hair] Woah, it's purple
sweet potato flavor.
- From the box, it looks like a Kit Kat

from like a nightmare that
Willy Wonka would have.
- It doesn't taste like anything.
- Oh, it's taro.
Purple sweet potato, right? Yeah.
- It doesn't taste like flowers,
it doesn't taste like potatoes.

- Nothing about this tastes
like potato or purple.
- If you like taro you'll like this.

If you don't, and you're
just like, "The (bleep)?"

It's vaguely sweet and tastes
kind of like ice cream.
But it's good.
- [Man in Glasses] What? What?
What are you?
- Oh come on, this is so ridiculous.
Why do you have to heat up candy?
- This looks like duck poop.
- It tastes like maple syrup.
- It's like cinnamony.
It smells like a candle.

It's like you walk into
your grandma's house
and this is the smell.
She just burning Kit Kats.
- It is like creme brulee.
- I mean it's delicious, but like why?
Why?
- No one's gonna be heating up a Kit Kat.
I'm gonna tell you this right now.

No one in America is gonna
be heating up a Kit Kat.

- It's probably the most
delicious Kit Kat I've ever had,
to be honest.

- It's delicious, but
they take their Kit Kats
so goddamn seriously over there.
- I think there's something about knowing
your place in the world.
And a Kit Kat you should not try and
elevate itself to a baked pastry.
(Whistling Kit Kat theme song)

comments.text:
So for anyone who doesn't know, Kit-Kat is pronounced "kitto-katto" in 
Japanese, which roughly translates to "You'll surely win". People usually 
give these Kit-Kats as gifts to people before important exams or tests. 
Over time they got more popular, so Japan decided to expand on the idea of 
what kind of flavors can be placed around two wafers :)

tl;dr Japan has special customs involving Kit-Kats.﻿
